thread.title: 'How did that actually happen?': Reaction and conspiracy theories as an unprecedented disaster strikes at the Oscars
thread.title_full: 'How did that actually happen?': Reaction and conspiracy theories as an unprecedented disaster strikes at the Oscars

author: Zoe Shenton
title: 'How did that actually happen?': Reaction and conspiracy theories as an unprecedented disaster strikes at the Oscars
text:
'Moonlight' actor Mahershala Ali hugs Emma Stone (Photo: Getty Images North America) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Disaster stuck at this years Oscars - the first in the ceremony's 88 year history. 
Embarrassingly, Warren Beatty read out the WRONG name for Best Picture, causing La La Land's Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling to hug and kiss in celebration. 
The movie's cast and crew even took to the stage to accept the award, before being told they actually hadn't won and the top accolade went to Moonlight. 
Twitter exploded as the huge gaffe was revealed in full - and viewers were actually baffled how it managed to happen. Some said it was because host Warren was given the wrong envelope by production team - naming Emma Stone as the best actress. The cast of "Moonlight" and ""La La Land" appear on stage (Photo: AFP) The cast of "Moonlight" and ""La La Land" appear on stage as presenter Warren Beatty (C) (Photo: AFP) 
Others summised the Oscars was hacked. Either way, it is a huge embarrassment for all involved. 
One viewer took to Twitter, asking: "Damn I really really wish this happened election night. For real." 
People were so shocked - and were saddened Moonlight didn't get a full speech. 
"That was horribly uncomfortable. Such a shame for La La Land. Such a shame for Moonlight . They deserved their big winning moment," one viewer wrote. Jimmy Kimmel and Warren Beatty laugh after correcting the Best Picture Oscar (Photo: REUTERS) US actor Warren Beatty (C) (Photo: AFP) 
Another fumed: "What a joke, miss universe all over again!" 
Host of the night Jimmy Kimmel looked completely perplexed as Warren explained that he had misread the card. 
“I’m still not sure this is real,” producer Adele Romanski said after going up to collect the gong from the La La Land cast. 
Elsewhere, Casey Affleck scooped the Best Actor award for his role by Manchester In The Sea, while Emma took home the Best Actress gong for her role in La La Land. 
Viola Davis won the Best Supporting Actress gong for her role in Fences, while Mahershala Ali took home the Supporting Actor award for his role in Moonlight. Like us on Facebook
